It was released on 2024, September 26. Xiaomi Redmi Note 14 has 6.67 inch, OLED, 120Hz, HDR10+, 2100 nits (peak), a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixels screen with Corning Gorilla Glass 5. Xiaomi Redmi Note 14 uses Mediatek Dimensity 7025 Ultra (6 nm) chipset, Octa-core (2×2.5 GHz Cortex-A78 & 6×2.0 GHz Cortex-A55) CPU, IMG BXM-8-256 GPU. It supports 2G, 3G, 4G, 5G networks with Dual SIM (Nano-SIM, dual stand-by). It has 5MP Dual main camera, 16MP Single selfie camera. Xiaomi Redmi Note 14 uses 5110 mAh, non-removable battery.Design and DisplayThe core design of both phones remains the same, however, the Redmi has given the Note 14 5G enough tweaks to be visually distinguishable. The camera cutout has grown larger, while the back panel has gone back to being curved. Similarly, the camera island has gone a bit softer with the edge, and the LED flash has shifted a couple of millimetres. The phone offers an added level of durability with an IP64 rating, reinforced internal design, and a Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection.On the front, it has a 6.67-inch OLED screen with FHD+ resolution. It offers a refresh rate of up to 120Hz and a peak brightness of 2,100 nits. You also get a standard and instantaneous touch sampling rate of 240Hz and 2,160Hz respectively. The display is capable of HDR10+ and covers the DCI-P3 colour gamut. Moreover, it has received TÜV and SGS certifications for eye care features like low blue light.Network:The phone has supported 2G, 3G, 4G, and 5G Network facilities. Moreover, GPRS and EDGE facilities also have. HSPA 42.2/5.76 Mbps, LTE-A, 5G speed on the phone.PerformanceThe MediaTek Dimensity 7025 Ultra serves as the brain of the Redmi Note 14 5G. With 6nm fabrication and a higher 2.5GHz clock speed, this chipset offers a decent upgrade over the Dimensity 6080 on its predecessor. Furthermore, the phone is available in four configurations: 6GB + 128GB, 8GB + 128GB, 8GB + 256GB, and 12GB + 256GB. For battery, it has a sizable 5,110 mAh cell with 45W charging support.Camera and the restThe primary shooter on the Redmi Note 14 5G is a 50MP OIS-enabled lens coupled with a Sony LYT-600 sensor. While the resolution on the newer phone drops by half compared to its predecessor, the higher-quality Sony sensor should make up for any possible compromise. Additionally, there is a 2MP auxiliary lens helping out with depth detection and bokeh effect. It barely adds to the photography experience though. Meanwhile, a 16MP camera sits on the front for selfies and face scanning.Connectivity-wise, you get dual-SIM support with 5G cellular, dual-band WiFi 5, and Bluetooth v5.3 for wireless medium. On the other hand, a USB Type-C port and a 3.5mm headphone jack handle the wired connections. For additional security, there is an in-display fingerprint sensor. The company also mentions “Heart rate detection” as a feature on this phone, but refuses to elaborate any further. It was released on 2024, September 26. Xiaomi Redmi Note 14 has 6.67 inch, OLED, 120Hz, HDR10+, 2100 nits (peak), a resolution of 1080 x 2400 pixels screen with Corning Gorilla Glass 5. Xiaomi Redmi Note 14 uses Mediatek Dimensity 7025 Ultra (6 nm) chipset, Octa-core (2×2.5 GHz Cortex-A78 & 6×2.0 GHz Cortex-A55) CPU, IMG BXM-8-256 GPU. It supports 2G, 3G, 4G, 5G networks with Dual SIM (Nano-SIM, dual stand-by). It has 5MP Dual main camera, 16MP Single selfie camera. Xiaomi Redmi Note 14 uses 5110 mAh, non-removable battery.Design and DisplayThe core design of both phones remains the same, however, the Redmi has given the Note 14 5G enough tweaks to be visually distinguishable. The camera cutout has grown larger, while the back panel has gone back to being curved. Similarly, the camera island has gone a bit softer with the edge, and the LED flash has shifted a couple of millimetres. The phone offers an added level of durability with an IP64 rating, reinforced internal design, and a Corning Gorilla Glass 5 protection.On the front, it has a 6.67-inch OLED screen with FHD+ resolution. It offers a refresh rate of up to 120Hz and a peak brightness of 2,100 nits. You also get a standard and instantaneous touch sampling rate of 240Hz and 2,160Hz respectively. The display is capable of HDR10+ and covers the DCI-P3 colour gamut. Moreover, it has received TÜV and SGS certifications for eye care features like low blue light.Network:The phone has supported 2G, 3G, 4G, and 5G Network facilities. Moreover, GPRS and EDGE facilities also have. HSPA 42.2/5.76 Mbps, LTE-A, 5G speed on the phone.PerformanceThe MediaTek Dimensity 7025 Ultra serves as the brain of the Redmi Note 14 5G. With 6nm fabrication and a higher 2.5GHz clock speed, this chipset offers a decent upgrade over the Dimensity 6080 on its predecessor. Furthermore, the phone is available in four configurations: 6GB + 128GB, 8GB + 128GB, 8GB + 256GB, and 12GB + 256GB. For battery, it has a sizable 5,110 mAh cell with 45W charging support.Camera and the restThe primary shooter on the Redmi Note 14 5G is a 50MP OIS-enabled lens coupled with a Sony LYT-600 sensor. While the resolution on the newer phone drops by half compared to its predecessor, the higher-quality Sony sensor should make up for any possible compromise. Additionally, there is a 2MP auxiliary lens helping out with depth detection and bokeh effect. It barely adds to the photography experience though. Meanwhile, a 16MP camera sits on the front for selfies and face scanning.Connectivity-wise, you get dual-SIM support with 5G cellular, dual-band WiFi 5, and Bluetooth v5.3 for wireless medium. On the other hand, a USB Type-C port and a 3.5mm headphone jack handle the wired connections. For additional security, there is an in-display fingerprint sensor. The company also mentions “Heart rate detection” as a feature on this phone, but refuses to elaborate any further. Powered by the Snapdragon 695 chipset with options for 8GB RAM and either 128GB or 256GB storage, it runs on Android 14 with OxygenOS 14. The phone boasts a 50 MP main camera with OIS, a 2 MP depth camera, and a 16 MP front camera. It houses a 5500 mAh battery with 80W wired charging, stereo speakers, and a 3.5mm headphone jack.Design and DisplayThe new OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite measures 8.1 mm in thickness and weighs 191 grams. It features a glass front, plastic frame, and plastic back. Additionally, it is IP54 rated, making it dust and splash-resistant. The device is available in three colors: Super Silver, Mega Blue, and Ultra Orange.The Nord CE 4 Lite comes with a 6.67-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate and a peak brightness level of 2100 nits. In addition, the display resolution is 1080 x 2400 pixels, providing approximately 395 ppi density.Performance and Operating SystemThe OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite operates on Android 14 with OxygenOS 14. Although it was rumored to house the Snapdragon 6s Gen 3, it now features the Snapdragon 695 chipset housing an Adreno 619 GPU. Moreover, there are two memory variants available: 8GB RAM with 128GB storage and 8GB RAM with 256GB storage.Camera The main camera setup of the Nord CE4 Lite includes a 50 MP Sony LYT600 sensor with OIS and a 2 MP depth camera. This dual-camera system records video at 1080p@30fps with gyro-EIS. The front camera is a 16 MP sensor, also supporting 1080p@30fps video recording with gyro-EIS.Battery and ChargingThe OnePlus Nord CE 4 Lite has a 5500 mAh non-removable battery. It supports 80W wired charging, capable of charging from 1-100% in 52 minutes, as advertised. Additionally, it features 5W reverse wired charging. In addition, the device is equipped with stereo speakers and a 3.5mm headphone jack. However, it does not support NFC.
